alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Crowley County; Eastern Las Animas County; La Junta Vicinity, Otero County; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Trinidad Vicinity, Western Las Animas County Below 7500 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 5:07PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Light to Moderate Snow Continues This Evening... Light, to at times moderate, snow will continue through mid to late evening across parts of the I-25 and Highway 50 corridors. Snow currently focused over Teller and El Paso counties will expand south and southeast over the next couple of hours, with snow likely in place from the Colorado Springs area south through Pueblo and into Aguilar. Additionally, this snow is expected to move into more of the Highway 50 corridor during this time, possibly reaching the La Junta area. Additional snowfall amounts up to one inch, locally one to two inches, can be expected this evening. Anyone traveling across these areas can expect reduced visibility to around one mile at times, and snow covered roads and slippery conditions.
